intro: Seseli songoricum, commonly known as the Songor Mountains seseli, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptations to harsh climates. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine layer of hairs, aiding in water retention. Seseli songoricum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
